verses.verse: From this, sacred brothers (joint possessors of a heavenly invitation), take a closer look at the Missionary and Head Priest of our acknowledgment, the Anointed King Jesus,
who is trustable to the One who made Him the Head Priest, as Moses also was in his whole house.
You see, this Head Priest has deserved more magnificence than Moses, inasmuch as the One who designed it (the house) has more value than the house;
for every house is designed by someone, but the One who designed all the things is God.
And Moses certainly is trustable in His whole house (as an attending servant) for a witness of the things that will be spoken.
But the Anointed King (as a son) is over His house, whose house we are if it is true that we steadily have the straightforwardness and the bragging of the anticipation firm up to the conclusion.
For this reason, it is just as the Spirit, the Sacred Spirit, says, (in Psalm 95:7-11) "Today, if you will listen to His voice,
you should not harden your hearts as in the rebellion throughout the day of the trouble in the backcountry
where your fathers tried to cause trouble with Me. They examined Me and saw My actions forty years.
For this reason, I was aggravated with that generation, and I said, 'They are always misled with the heart. They didn't know My ways.'
It is as I guaranteed in My punishment, 'If they will come into My resting place, may I be punished.'"
Brothers, see that there will never be in any of you an evil heart of a lack of trust during the time for you to stay away from the living God.
But encourage yourselves throughout each day till a time that is called the "Today," so that no one from among you might be hardened by the sin's fraud.
You see, we have become joint possessors of the Anointed King if it is true that we steadily have the beginning of the substance firm up to the conclusion,
during the time for it to be said, "Today, if you will listen to His voice, you should not harden your hearts as in the rebellion."
You see, who rebelled after they heard? But who? Not all the people who came out of Egypt through Moses.
Who was He aggravated with for forty years? Was it not with the people who sinned, whose carcasses fell in the backcountry?
To whom did He guarantee for them not to go into His resting place, except to the people who did not believe?
And we see that they were not able to go in because of a lack of trust.
